Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe the different types of habitats (e.g., land habitats like playgrounds, gardens, forests, parking lots, and water habitats like ponds, streams, lakes) in their drawing.
The student can show a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare and show the diversity of plants and animals that exist in different habitats.
The student can use patterns to highlight the differences and similarities of biodiversity across the illustrated habitats.
